page.title: 15LANDSCAPE
page.content: The area is typical of the present day new forest. It consists of a large tracks of peat heath. Bracken and scrubland which is not cultivatable it is not a well developed agricultured area. It has an average height of approximately 35 to 40 metres. The soils are mainly acidic with a high silica content as a result of the underlying itrata (ref. geology). The flora reflects the acidic nature of the soils with gorse, heatiner and Rhodadendroms with a varietie of wild flowers in marsh and river habitats. A major change in the recent decades has been the "afforestation" programme conducted by the forestry commission.
